page.title: 06Craft in Stogumber
page.content: {Stogumber Woodwork,}at Wayshill on the outskirts of Stogumber, is run by Ralph Farrer. His hand-made {furniture,}such as tables, chairs, cabinets and chests of drawers, is produced from quality hardwoods. He also makes smaller low priced articles such as stools, solitaire boards, glass mats and lamp bases. Above the workshop at Wayshill is a showroom where visitors can inspect samples of his work. Mr. Farrer began working in{Stogumber in 1963. } Mrs. Parkin is a school teacher living in Stogumber who taught herself to{spin when she retired in l982. She uses mainly fleece from Dorset, Exmoor and Jacob sheep. She has a spinning wheel which spins the fleece into wool. To colour the wool she uses{natural dyes made from leaves, {berries flowers and nuts. }
